column2: WISCONSIN DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Wisconsin

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: This street is reserved for trucks

column2: 3. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers must turn right

column2: 5. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
column6: oncoming vehicles might not see you.
column8: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.

column2: 6. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column4: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 7. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: flash your lights.
column6: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column8: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 8. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.

column2: 9. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the left.
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way

column2: 11. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: exiting a freeway.
column8: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 12. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column6: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 13. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column6: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column10: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.

column2: 14. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 15. Lane markings that separate traffic moving in opposite direction are:
column4: yellow.

column2: 16. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.
column6: let them pass if it's safe to do so.

column2: 17. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column4: brown and white.

column2: 18. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 19. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: at an intersection with a stop sign.

column2: 20. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: an advance warning sign.

column2: 21. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column4: when the road is wet.

column2: 22. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 23. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 24. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Honk your horn.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 25. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Turn left or go through

column2: 27. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 28. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 29. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column10: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: You must turn right at the intersection

column2: 31. When you see this sign you should:
column4: watch for traffic to the right.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn

column2: 33. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Law

column2: 34. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Reduced visibility.
column10: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 35. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column2: 36. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently
column6: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 37. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the right side of the road.
column6: straight down the middle of the road.
column8: towards the left side of the road.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 38. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.

column2: 39. This sign means:
column4: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 40. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column10: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 41. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 42. This road sign means:
column4: Highway entrance ramp ahead
column6: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon
column8: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon

column2: 43. Before driving after a snowfall, you should clear snow from your car's:
column4: headlights.

column2: 44. This road sign means:
column4: Two way Traffic

column2: 45. This road sign means:
column4: Winding Road Ahead
column6: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 46. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: the road is narrower ahead.

column2: 47. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column6: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column8: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column10: go through when one of the tracks is free.

column2: 48. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is an intersection ahead.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 49. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 50. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
